task.title: Create a Bucket
task.shortdesc: A bucket is an object storage similar to a file system that allows you to store data on the Internet. You can upload any number of objects to a bucket.

taskbody.context: For more information about buckets, go to Working with Amazon S3 Buckets.

task.title: Create new bucket
task.shortdesc: Add the details of your bucket:

step.cmd: Enter a name for the bucket in the Name text box. Use DNS-compliant bucket names regardless of the region in which you create the bucket. For more information on bucket naming conventions, go to AWS Bucket Restrictions and Limitations.
Click the Create Bucket button to create your new bucket, or click the Cancel button to cancel the operation.
step.stepresult: The Bucket Details page for your newly created bucket opens. A default sharing setting of Private Full Control is appied to all newly-created buckets, meaning the bucket owner is the only one who has full access to it.
